Name: Amulet shaped like a bird
Description: This amulet has the form of a stylised bird in the shape of a crescent. It is flat and only bevelled at the edges. At one end is a downturned beak. There are shallow holes on both sides for the eyes, inlaid with a ring of bone. In the middle of the back is a suspension loop. A similar even simpler example is held by the Hessian Landesmuseum in Darmstadt. Slate palettes like these have also been interpreted as pseudo-barks.
